text: The Promised Land (, translit.: ha'aretz hamuvtakhat; , translit.: ard al- mi'ad; also known as "The Land of Milk and Honey") is very important in the Hebrew Bible. It is the land that God promised to Abraham and his descendants. Nowadays, it refers to the restored homeland for the Jewish people, a path to salvation and liberation, or both. == Related pages == * Book of Genesis * Canaan * Conquest of Canaan * Land of Israel * Who is a Jew? Category:Zionism Category:Jewish history Category:Hebrew Bible Category:Old Testament
title: Promised Land
